reviews.review_msg: I went to office hours. She told me I wasn't intelligent enough for university and should go to trade school. I was on the Dean's List during my undergrad, and am doing a PhD. Her class was damaging. By the end of the semester, she dehumanized me and undermined my sense of capacity so badly that I almost left university without finishing my degree.

Awful teacher. The lectures and readings were inaccessible. Some students really struggled. When she handed papers back, one person got an F, and others could see. She joked that some students are incapable of 'doing philosophy', but need to fail miserably to find out.

She is one of the worst professors I have encountered.  Her grades based on participation marks is something I thought we gave up in elementary school.  Her grading is difficult, but only in that the expectations are not clear.  She lacks objectivity; after speaking to a multitude of other students, she may vie for worst philosophy professor at SFU
